material.mattext:
Quiz 4 - Inertial measurement units

This quiz covers Section 3.6 and Section 4.1-4.3 of the notes.

 Instructions

  • This quiz consists of 10 questions, covering content from the previous week.
  • You are allowed to submit the quiz an unlimited number of times with no time limit, and on each submission you can review each incorrect question attempt after the fact.
  • When reattempting the quiz, only the previously incorrect question(s) from the last attempted quiz will be available to attempt. The correct question(s) from the last attempted quiz will automatically be added to your score.

Given that a robot with an initial orientation of \(^W{\bf R}_0={\bf I}\) experiences a constant angular velocity of \(^B{\bf \omega}=[1 ~~ 0 ~~ 1]^T\), determine the resulting orientation after \(1\) second.

Given that a robot with an initial orientation of 

$${^W{\bf R}_0} = \left[\begin{array}{ccc}
0 & -1 & 0\\
1 & 0 & 0\\
0 & 0 & 1
\end{array}\right]$$

experiences a constant angular velocity of \(^B{\bf \omega}=[1 ~~ 0 ~~ 1]^T\), determine the resulting orientation after \(1\) second.

Given that a robot with an initial orientation of 

$${^W{\bf q}_0} = \left[\begin{array}{ccc}
\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} & 0 & 0 & \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}
\end{array}\right]$$

experiences a constant angular velocity of \(^B{\bf \omega}=[1 ~~ 0 ~~ 1]^T\), determine the resulting orientation after \(1\) second.

Given a gyroscope estimate of 

$$\begin{array}{ll}
{^B{\bf \omega}^+}
&={^B{\bf \omega}^\#}-{{\bf b}^+_\omega},\\
&={^B{\bf \omega}}+\left({\bf b}_\omega-{{{\bf b}^+_\omega}}\right)+{\bf n}_\omega, 
\end{array}$$

select the options below that contribute to \({^B{\bf \omega}^+}\) being an imperfect measurement.
gyroscopes cannot measure rotational velocity about \(\hat{\bf z}_W\)
the update rates of gyroscopes are very low relative to the motion of most robots.
Orientation can be reliably estimated using only a gyroscope.

Given an accelerometer measurement of 

$${^B{\bf a}^\#} = \left[\begin{array}{ccc}
0 & 9.8 & 0
\end{array}\right]^T,$$

determine the rotation matrix corresponding to the current orientation of \(\{B\}\) with respect to \(\{W\}\).

Given an accelerometer measurement of 

$${^B{\bf a}^\#} = \left[\begin{array}{ccc}
0 & 9.8 & 0
\end{array}\right]^T,$$

determine the quaternion corresponding to the current orientation of \(\{B\}\) with respect to \(\{W\}\).
Under what condition are accelerometers not able to detect rotations?
Select the conditions required for an accelerometer to estimate translational acceleration.

Perform normalisation on the matrix below. You can assume that the third column vector is pointing in the correction direction and follow the order of \({\bf c}_3\rightarrow {\bf c}_1 \rightarrow {\bf c}_2\).

$${{\bf R}} = \left[\begin{array}{ccc}
1.2 & 0 & 0.1 \\ -0.1 & 0.9 & 0 \\ 0 & 0.2 & 0.9
\end{array}\right]$$
